title: Quebec City
summary: Quebec City (/kwɪˈbɛk/ (listen) or /kəˈbɛk/;[11] French: Ville de Québec), officially Québec ([kebɛk] (listen)),[12] is the capital city of the Canadian province of Quebec. As of July 2016, the city had a population of 531,902,[13] and the metropolitan area had a population of 800,296.[14] It is the eleventh-largest city and the seventh-largest metropolitan area in Canada. It is also the second-largest city in the province after Montreal.
